intro: Erigeron aucheri, commonly known as the blueweed or blue thistle, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silvery-blue foliage and showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in the summer months. Native to the western United States, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a border plant. Its ornamental value comes from its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
